item.title: Nahid add a quote by Nahid Rachlin
item.description: "When it is dark enough, you can see the stars" An ancient Persian proverb" -- Nahid Rachlin

item.title: Nahid add a quote by Nahid Rachlin
item.description: ". . . Don't live in the world as if you were renting or here only for the summer, but act as if it was your father's house. . .Believe in seeds, earth, and the sea, but people above all. Love clouds, machines, and books, but people above all." Nazim Hikmet, 20th century Turkish poet" -- Nahid Rachlin

item.title: Nahid add a quote by Omar Khayyam
item.description: "I sent my Soul through the Invisible, Some letter of that After-life to spell: And by and by my Soul return'd to me, And answer'd: 'I Myself am Heav'n and Hell" -- Omar Khayyam

item.title: Nahid add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "You think of yourself as a citizen of the universe. You think you belong to this world of dust and matter. Out of this dust you have created a personal image, and have forgotten about the essence of your true origin" -- Rumi

item.title: Nahid add a quote by Bernard Cornwall
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining, show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Bernard Cornwall
